ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Selos breaking root was not a bug
ygData.msgSnippet: Hooray!  The King is dead!  Long Live The King!  (or should I be singing the witch is dead, which old witch, the wicked witch... ) Now, maybe some shit that
ygData.messageBody:
Hooray! The King is dead! Long Live The King! (or should I be singing
"the witch is dead, which old witch, the wicked witch...")

Now, maybe some shit that "can't be done" will start getting done. The new
guys breathed some much needed life into a dismal user interface in short
order. Now, maybe some other much needed changes will happen too. The fact
that they are even discussing ways to increase exp gains - is a good thing -
a real good thing. I dont really care what "GZ" ever said in the past - they
all said lots of stuff and then turned around and did exactly the opposite
or were just flat out wrong...

"These new epic quests have been thoroughly tested..."
"Kunark 50+ spells are dropping..."
"Bard mez spells are working right..."
"Selos should break root..."

They were wrong before - they will prolly be wrong again but at least we
dont have the old guys with what seemed like an ingrained predjudice against
any inference that what they just coded/designed might be not working
correctly. Programmers have a very hard time finding errors in their own
code because they first need to believe that an error exists. The old guy's
(plural - I am blanketly lumping GZ and the rest of "them" - whoever they
are toegther) attitude was a major factor in a lot of problems with the game
and Verant.

Just my humble opinions =)

Sylly Songsynger
(The Pantheon)
Troubador, somewhere on Innoruuk...

Subject: Re: [eqbards] Selos breaking root was not a bug

MacGrough Mich'Rathe
